name: Tidal Memento
real_text:
Wendy Adams deck only. Permanent.
[reaction] When an enemy would ready or doom would be placed on it, release a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on that enemy: Cancel that effect.
[reaction] During a skill test you are performing, when a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag: Resolve a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on an enemy instead.

name: Wendy's Amulet
real_text: Wendy Adams deck only. Advanced. You may play any event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.
text: Wendy Adams deck only. Advanced. You may play any event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.

flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
name: Abandoned and Alone
real_text: Advanced. Revelation - Remove all non-weakness cards in your discard pile from the game. If no cards were removed by this effect, shuffle this card back into your deck. Otherwise, take 3 direct horror.
text: Advanced. Revelation - Remove all non-weakness cards in your discard pile from the game. If no cards were removed by this effect, shuffle this card back into your deck. Otherwise, take 3 direct horror.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. (-5 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -4. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
name: Red Tide Rising
real_text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. (-4 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -3. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -1. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. (-4 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -3. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -1. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.

back_flavor: You’re used to people turning you down and pushing you away, but for some reason, the locals here are even more upset at your prying questions than you could have expected. The last person you speak to is a man who reeks of fish, with pale, sickly skin and strange ridges across his neck. Next thing you know, you are being followed everywhere you go, and the lot of them don’t look all too friendly.
back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Angry Mob enemy at Innsmouth Square, exhausted.
Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on each [[Suspect]] enemy and [[Hideout]] location in play.
flavor: You arrive in Innsmouth and immediately set to work asking the townspeople if they’ve seen your Dad, the place in the photograph, or the man in the derby who dropped off the photo.
name: The New Girl
real_text: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and shuffle a random set-aside [[Monster]] enemy into the [[Leads]] deck. Then, if there are no set-aside [[Monster]] enemies, advance to agenda 1b.
text: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and shuffle a random set-aside [[Monster]] enemy into the [[Leads]] deck. Then, if there are no set-aside [[Monster]] enemies, advance to agenda 1b.

back_flavor: You hide behind a sour-smelling pile of trash and wait for the pounding of heavy steps as the mob searches relentlessly for you. You don’t know why they’re after you—you were only asking questions!—but it’s clear you can’t stay here any longer. In Arkham, everyone’s gaze passes right over street urchins like you. Suddenly, you wish that were the case here, too.
flavor: The longer you stick around and the more questions you ask, the more danger seeks you out. The locals eye you with anger and suspicion, and worse: strange winged creatures prowl about the rooftops, searching for prey...
name: Trail Goes Cold
real_text:
Angry Mob cannot be defeated.
[reaction] After Wendy Adams evades Angry Mob: She may discover 1 clue from its location.
Each [[Suspect]] enemy loses aloof and enters play with +1 [per_investigator] clues.
Each [[Hideout]] location gets +1 [per_investigator] clue value.
text:
Angry Mob cannot be defeated.
[reaction] After Wendy Adams evades Angry Mob: She may discover 1 clue from its location.
Each [[Suspect]] enemy loses aloof and enters play with +1 [per_investigator] clues.
Each [[Hideout]] location gets +1 [per_investigator] clue value.

back_flavor:
It’s no use. Maybe Dad was in Innsmouth at some point, but he’s long gone now. And the townsfolk here don’t seem too keen on anybody asking about him. Might be they know more than they’re letting on, or it might just be they’re protecting other, unrelated secrets. Either way, it’s no longer safe to stick around.
But just as you are ready to give up and head back to the bus stop to return to Arkham, you spot a man in a familiar outfit: a long wool coat and a brown derby.
flavor: To say that this town is less friendly than even Arkham would be an understatement.
name: Searching for Dad
real_text: [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards cannot be added to the victory display except using Mysterious Photo. Forced – If there are no [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] cards in play: Wendy Adams must draw cards from the top of the Leads deck until she draws a [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] card. Objective – Search for Dad using Mysterious Photo. The fewer cards that remain in the Leads deck, the better. If it is empty, advance.
text: [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards cannot be added to the victory display except using Mysterious Photo. linked_card.name: Mysterious Photo
linked_card.real_text: [fast] Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take an investigate action at a [[Hideout]] location or flip Mysterious Photo over. [fast] If you are at a [[Hideout]] location with no clues on it, investigators at that location spend clues, as a group, equal to its clue value: “Where is Dad now?” Add that location to the victory display, moving each enemy and investigator there to a connecting location.
linked_card.subname: All I Have Left of Him
linked_card.text: Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take an investigate action at a Hideout location or flip Mysterious Photo over. If you are at a Hideout location with no clues on it, investigators at that location spend clues, as a group, equal to its clue value: “Where is Dad now?” Add that location to the victory display, moving each enemy and investigator there to a connecting location.

name: Mysterious Photo

[fast] If there is a [[Suspect]] enemy with no clues on it at your location, investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if it is agenda 2): “Have you seen my dad?” Add that enemy to the victory display.
